tool.name: Scanpy ComputeGraph
tool.command:
ln -s '${input_obj_file}' input.h5 && PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8 scanpy-neighbors #if $settings.default == "false" #if $settings.n_neighbors_file #set f = open($settings.n_neighbors_file.__str__) #set n_neighbors = f.read().strip() #silent f.close #elif $settings.n_neighbors #set n_neighbors = $settings.n_neighbors.__str__.strip() #end if
#if $n_neighbors --n-neighbors $n_neighbors #end if #if $settings.key_added #set key_added = $settings.key_added #if $n_neighbors #set key_added = $key_added.replace('N_NEIGHBORS', $n_neighbors.__str__) #end if --key-added '${key_added}' #end if
--method '${settings.method}' --metric '${settings.metric}' --random-state '${settings.random_seed}' #if $settings.use_rep --use-rep '${settings.use_rep}' #end if #if $settings.n_pcs --n-pcs '${settings.n_pcs}' #end if ${settings.knn} #end if @INPUT_OPTS@ @OUTPUT_OPTS@

param.name: key_added
param.label: Key added
param.help: If not specified, the neighbors data is stored in .uns[‘neighbors’], distances and connectivities are stored in .obsp[‘distances’] and .obsp[‘connectivities’] respectively. If specified, the neighbors data is added to .uns[key_added], distances are stored in .obsp[key_added+’_distances’] and connectivities in .obsp[key_added+’_connectivities’].

param.name: n_neighbors_file
param.label: File with n_neighbours, use with parameter iterator. Overrides the n_neighbors setting

param.name: use_rep
param.label: Use the indicated representation
param.help: 'X' (for the content of .X, usually normalised expression values) or any key for .obsm (e.g. X_pca for PCA) is valid. If not set, the representation is chosen automatically: For .n_vars less than 50, .X is used, otherwise ‘X_pca’ is used. If ‘X_pca’ is not present, it’s computed with default parameters.

param.name: knn
param.label: Use hard threshold to restrict neighbourhood size (otherwise use a Gaussian kernel to down weight distant neighbors)
